revised_title: Anatomy and Development of Cloaca and Copulatory Organs in Amniota
tldr: The author examines the cloaca and copulatory organs of various Amniota species, discussing their anatomy, development, and evolutionary relationships. They describe the three main chambers of the cloaca and their functions, as well as the nerve supply and muscle structures involved. The study also includes a discussion of the differences between male and female Crocodilia in terms of duct development.
